elements.label: Profane Weapon
elements.description: A fine weapon, but a worldly one. [Ordinary weapons can harm most of your pursuers, but not your Foe.]

elements.label: Foe: An Unknown Weakness
elements.description: My Foe is vulnerable to certain distractions. [You can find out exactly what through experimentation or revelation.]

elements.label: Foe: A Weakness
elements.description: My Foe is vulnerable to this particular distraction... which might help me decide where best to face him.

elements.label: Renewal
elements.description: recipe aspect

elements.label: Minor Trace Risk
elements.description: recipe aspect

elements.label: Trace Risk
elements.description: recipe aspect

elements.label: Major Trace Risk
elements.description: recipe aspect

elements.label: Terrible Trace Risk
elements.description: recipe aspect

elements.label: Epiphany: Colonel
elements.description: recipe aspect

elements.label: Epiphany: Lionsmith
elements.description: recipe aspect

elements.label: Needs Edge
elements.description: There is a complication, but this much Edge would resolve it.

elements.label: Needs Forge
elements.description: There is a complication, but this much Forge would resolve it.

elements.label: Needs Grail
elements.description: There is a complication, but this much Grail would resolve it.

elements.label: Needs Heart
elements.description: There is a complication, but this much Heart would resolve it.

elements.label: Needs Knock
elements.description: There is a complication, but this much Knock would resolve it.

elements.label: Needs Lantern
elements.description: There is a complication, but this much Lantern would resolve it.

elements.label: Needs Moth
elements.description: There is a complication, but this much Moth would resolve it.

elements.label: Needs Secret Histories
elements.description: There is a complication, but this much Secret Histories would resolve it.

elements.label: Needs Winter
elements.description: There is a complication, but this much Winter would resolve it.

elements.label: A property purchase opportunity
elements.description: Used to mark rkx internal components

elements.label: Reckoner internal
elements.description: Used to mark rkx internal components

elements.label: Safety from Pursuit
elements.description: [You won't see Reckoner pursuit while this is on the board.]

elements.label: False trail marker: DO NOT TRANSLATE
Doctor op marker: DO NOT TRANSLATE
sanatorium op marker: DO NOT TRANSLATE
Miracles op marker: DO NOT TRANSLATE
flowermaker op marker: DO NOT TRANSLATE
horned op marker: DO NOT TRANSLATE
wolf op marker: DO NOT TRANSLATE
counterfeiting op marker: DO NOT TRANSLATE
smuggling op marker: DO NOT TRANSLATE
import op marker: DO NOT TRANSLATE
fights op marker: DO NOT TRANSLATE
uprising op marker: DO NOT TRANSLATE
betrayal op marker: DO NOT TRANSLATE
patronage op marker: DO NOT TRANSLATE
Supplies
elements.description: Finite, like a lifetime. [Supplies are consumed when used.]

elements.label: Complication
elements.description: Used to mark opx events

elements.label: Negotiation
elements.description: recipe aspect

elements.label: Purchase
elements.description: recipe aspect

elements.label: Arriving
elements.description: recipe aspect

elements.label: Provoking
elements.description: recipe aspect

elements.label: Op Populate 2
elements.description: recipe aspect: populates an operation with third escalation event spawns

elements.label: Opx Populate 1
elements.description: recipe aspect: populates an operation with second escalation event spawns

elements.label: Opx Populate 0
elements.description: recipe aspect: populates an operation with first escalation event spawns

elements.label: Success
elements.description: recipe aspect

elements.label: Failure
elements.description: recipe aspect

elements.label: Uprising
elements.description: recipe aspect

elements.label: Striking Foe
elements.description: recipe aspect - hit a foe with

elements.label: Striking Underling
elements.description: recipe aspect - hit an underling

elements.label: Striking Foe with Weapon
elements.description: recipe aspect - hit a foe with specifically a weapon

elements.label: Striking Underling with Weapon
elements.description: recipe aspect - hit an underling with specifically a weapon

elements.label: Mortal intro
elements.description: recipe aspect

elements.label: Reckoner Promotion
elements.description: recipe aspect

elements.label: Foe Lure
elements.comments: hidden mutation applied to domicile that infallibly brings the Foe if an rkx verb is running

elements.label: Sent a message to the Foe, revealing my whereabouts.
Defeated a reckoner and proved it with a trophy.
Sent a weapon to the Foe.
Shrine of the Edge
elements.description: A place dedicated to an Hour of struggle and conflict.

elements.label: Shrine: Colonel
elements.description: A secret shrine of a secret god: the power sometimes known as the Colonel. My Foe had some dealings with the Colonel, and my old mob was discouraged from visiting his shrines.

elements.label: A Cult of the Colonel
elements.description: If my intelligence is correct, there's a cult of the Colonel somewhere in this city.

elements.label: Shrine: Lionsmith
elements.description: A secret shrine of a secret god: the power sometimes known as the Lionsmith. My old mob knew to avoid his shrines.

elements.label: A Cult of the Lionsmith
elements.description: If my intelligence is correct, there's a cult of the Lionsmith somewhere in this city.

elements.label: Reckoner Demotion
elements.description: recipe aspect

elements.label: Reckoner Rank
elements.description: Lower-ranked reckoners are just people paid to do bad things. Higher-ranked reckoners are cunning, well-connected and armoured in stolen years.

elements.label: Preparations
elements.description: I've sent funds ahead to make life in this place easier. [Once you've arrived, use this card with Communicate again to retrieve your funds.]

elements.label: Reckoner Presence
elements.description: My pursuers have already established a presence here.

elements.label: The Exercise of Defiance
elements.description: Cunning may answer Strength, Strength may answer Cunning, but how might we answer Agony? [As your Defiance rises, you'll draw the attention of the Edge Hours. If it reaches 7, you may be able to achieve something unexpected.]

elements.label: Place of Residence
elements.description: I'm here, for now.

elements.label: Stolen Lifespan
elements.description: Years from the lives of others: bought, stolen or extorted.

elements.label: Destination
elements.description: I might find safety here for a little longer...

elements.label: Remote
elements.description: It'll be a long hard journey. But, in my current circumstances, perhaps that should make it more attractive. [Travelling to this Destination is more expensive, but will earn you an Obscurity.]

elements.label: Troubled
elements.description: This place has seen better days. [It's harder to purchase desirable things in Troubled cities, and there may be other effects.]

elements.label: Map's Edge
elements.description: The time may come when I can run no further. Then I must choose whether to lose myself in the loneliest place I can find... or choose that place to turn and face my Foe. [It's not possible to leave an End location, and Allies won't follow you there.]

elements.label: Weapon
elements.description: 'Reach for the book - it is a weapon.' - Brecht

elements.label: Proof
elements.description: With the right papers, you can prove anything.
elements.comments: Chiefly here to allow some things to be slottable in Use

elements.label: Uses Remaining
elements.description: Something with no uses is, literally, useless.
Allows multiple elements to count towards Exile damage
Allows multiple elements to count towards Foe damage
Allows multiple elements to count towards Underling damage

elements.label: Opportunity
elements.description: Unrealised potential.

elements.label: Distraction
elements.description: At the right angle, anything can be a weapon.

elements.label: Ligeian Presence
elements.description: I don't know precisely what the Ligeia Club is; but all reckoners do know that its members are older and hungrier than any of our mobs. We've learnt to avoid them.

elements.label: Asset
elements.description: Something that won't object to being owned.

elements.label: Connection
elements.description: 'We read that we ought to forgive our enemies; but we do not read that we ought to forgive our friends.' - Cosimo de'Medici

elements.label: Worth
elements.description: If I had to convert this into cash, how much would it be worth?

elements.label: Price in Years
elements.description: Some things are too precious to buy with money. Fewer things are too precious to buy with heartbeats.

elements.label: Price: a Helping Hand
elements.description: [Use an appropriate Connection to purchase this.]

elements.label: Price
elements.description: 'PRICE, n. Value, plus a reasonable sum for the wear and tear of conscience in demanding it.' - Bierce. [Provide this or greater in Worth.]

elements.label: Space
elements.description: Room for a venue, or a base of operations.

elements.label: Comfort
elements.description: There are joys that even money can't buy. This is not numbered among them.

elements.label: Local Contact
elements.description: Someone who belongs here.

elements.label: Associate
elements.description: They'll work with me.

elements.label: Ally
elements.description: I've won their trust. They'll follow me when I leave.

elements.label: Experience
elements.description: There's always something you don't know yet. [Once an Ally has three experience, you can increase their power.]

elements.label: Ally Upgrade
elements.description: Recipe Aspect

elements.label: Respects the Colonel
elements.description: Patience before strength.

elements.label: Respects the Lionsmith
elements.description: Courage before cunning.

elements.label: Payout aspect for operations DO NOT TRANSLATE
Portable
elements.description: An asset that might travel with you.

elements.label: Exhausted
elements.description: With a little time, this will recover.

elements.label: Assists Deception
elements.description: 'There is nothing more deceptive than an obvious fact.' - Arthur Conan Doyle.  [Anything with this aspect can be used to defeat Traces.]

elements.label: Pentiment
elements.description: I remember something Peel told me: 'The Nameless Name has been known to hunt out secrets in the Wake, and to bring them as gifts to the Velvet in the Wood. Also, cats have been known to bring mice indoors as gifts for their owners, but I don't think that always meets with the same degree of approval.'

elements.label: Pentiment
elements.description: Once, this was intended for a different purpose.

elements.label: Pentiment
elements.description: Perhaps something strayed in from another History.

elements.label: Pentiment
elements.description: Someone wasn't what they were meant to be.

elements.label: Pentiment
elements.description: Was the choice life, or death?

elements.label: Pentiment
elements.description: Something different was intended; and a trace remains.

elements.label: Pentiment
elements.description: Perhaps the author of this wound altered her intentions when she discovered who I was.

elements.label: Pentiment
elements.description: Something might have been different.

elements.label: Pentiment
elements.description: Once, this was strung in a very different configuration.

elements.label: Pentiment
elements.description: Once, something might have been different.

elements.label: Pentiment
elements.description: Mistakes were made. But that was not what had been intended, not at the beginning.

elements.label: Asset (Packed)
elements.description: An Asset, ready for travelling

elements.label: A New Faith?
elements.description: The congregation are hungry for something more. [If you achieve at least one Effectiveness when running a Faith-Healing Cult, you might be able to establish an Esoteric Cult.]

elements.label: Flowermaker Cult Paying Off
elements.comments: NB this is in addition to the cult seed base payout

elements.label: Horned-Axe Cult Paying Off
elements.comments: NB this is in addition to the cult seed base payout

elements.label: Wolf-Divided Cult Paying Off
elements.comments: NB this is in addition to the cult seed base payout

elements.label: Husk
elements.description: Something's been used up.

elements.label: A Human Corpse
elements.description: They're not here any more. I should make sure I'm not, either.

elements.label: A Reckoner Corpse
elements.description: Proof of a victory. This is going to make my Foe very upset.

elements.label: Momentum
elements.description: [Achieve three Momentum to complete a Caper.]

elements.label: Subtlety
elements.description: [Each level of Subtlety reduces the risk of spawning a Trace from an Operation. Three Subtlety will create an Obscurity.]

elements.label: Effectiveness
elements.description: [Each level of Effectiveness improves the final result of an Operation.]

elements.label: Next
elements.description: Recipe Effect

elements.label: Payment
elements.description: I've paid off a problem.

elements.label: Cash
elements.description: A considerable sum - enough to open a door, fund a project, or excite avarice.

elements.label: Misty Nook
elements.description: An unremarkable location that's somehow easier to stumble across at night. A nondescript candle has been jammed haphazardly into a crevice in the wall.

elements.label: Chapel of St Andrew Stratelates
elements.description: There's a side chapel in Aachen cathedral to a warrior saint who fought against the Persians. On certain days, a deacon will lock the door and perform unorthodox ceremonies for veterans.

elements.label: Roadside Shrine to an Iron Saint
elements.description: Beneath a rocky overhang, an ancient cast-iron statue stands in a whitewashed shelter. Its face has been scarred to unrecognisability, but one hand still holds a spear.

elements.label: Repurposed Datsan
elements.description: Unexpectedly, here's a Buddhist temple with painted doors and stained glass windows. But the paint is peeling and most of the windows have been boarded up. A certain Red Army battalion commander has taken the place over - supposedly for storage, but those of us who know the pass-words are permitted to join in stern ceremonies before the scarred face of the Buddha.

elements.label: Cellar Wotan
elements.description: In the deepest cellar of the Nationaltheater stands a stern image carved of Black Forest oak. Sixty years ago the Swan King staged a grandiose première of his favourite composer's new opera. It didn't go well. The stage-trappings were banished down here and forgotten. Now the image's eye has been scarred out to make him blind, and those who know of the place's power perform their harsh devotions before it.

elements.label: Scarred Lodge
elements.description: In a burnt-out hunting lodge at the edge of town, charred bone has been carved into chess-pieces, and a chess-board scored in the stone of the hearth.

elements.label: Fane of the One-Armed
elements.description: An abandoned grain silo has been adopted by a secret cult honouring an odd hero: the one-armed Briton who stormed the city for the White Russians, alone in a single tank. Perhaps he is now a Name. Perhaps he's only dead. But those who venerate the Colonel remember him.

elements.label: Mortal Shrine
elements.description: Malta is the Nurse of the Mediterranean, where soldiers come to be healed, and there are those among the healers who practice the invisible arts. They keep shrines in locked rooms in their hospitals to invoke the healing Hours. No-one prays to the Colonel for healing. They only visit this rotting room under the eaves to invoke him when death would be a mercy.

elements.label: Anvil of the Bull
elements.description: The 'anvil' here is a bronze altar of Apis, the Bull. Bronze is not a good metal for anvils, but the only material forged on this one is, the priests say, the human spirit.

elements.label: Skaptodon Tomb
elements.description: Sometimes a skaptodon becomes greedy, starts eating things they don't find in the earth, and degenerates to something like human shape. I learnt the hard way that it's much more difficult to kill a skaptodon that still has all its old strength. But one fell in battle here, and the shrine honours its bones.

elements.label: Hall of Brass Mirrors
elements.description: The marabout Navil spends much of his time here, although he denies being in the service of the Lionsmith. 'The greatest lion is the lion who has overcome himself,' he helpfully insists.

elements.label: Shahrewar Stone
elements.description: My poet friend told me the story of this place: that in the days when the sky was a polished roof of the hardest stone, the Lionsmith struck it with his hammer so that this great rock would fall to earth. It looks to me like a taenite meteorite, but that doesn't mean her story wasn't true. And that's why I try not to think too hard about the Histories.

elements.label: Crossroads Ateshgah
elements.description: The Party drove the worshippers out of this fire temple. Now a small cadre of military engineers operates here. But they've put considerable effort into maintaining the gas pipes that fuel the eternal flame, and their practices are notably eccentric.

elements.label: Antaeum
elements.description: The Imazighen - the people the world knows as the Berbers - venerate Antaios as a hero-king. Of course Antaios the Opponent, the Son of Earth, was a great enemy of the Lionsmith, but the Lionsmith has always respected his great enemies - or so say the initiates of the Antaeum.

elements.label: Chapel of St Mark of the Hammer
elements.description: The chivalric Ordine di San Marco was formally dissolved a century or so ago, but that didn't stop their more determined members from meeting in secret, continuing their less Christian rituals, and selling their services to the practitioners of the invisible arts. Their chapel is open to anyone they like enough, and we've always got on.

elements.label: Last Antaean Initiate
elements.comments: no killmortal trigger because we want him permanently on the board.
elements.description: An elderly man in a beaded skullcap, with deeply seamed cheeks, a whitening stubbled beard{} and old sorrow in his eyes.

elements.label: Old Retainer (Exhausted)
elements.comments: no killmortal trigger because we want him permanently on the board.
elements.description: An elderly man in a beaded skullcap, with deeply seamed cheeks, a whitening stubbled beard, and old sorrow in his eyes.

elements.label: Althiban Abyss
elements.description: 'There's a nasty sort of power stirring up in the mountains. Sealed away under the earth for years. But there was an earthquake, big hole opened up. Bureau tells me there's something weapon-y in there, and I'll be honest, I'd rather you had it than any of the local troublemakers.'

elements.label: The Invisible Serapeum
elements.description: The Serapeum is almost impossible to find... even when you're already inside it. With an invitation I have a better chance, though.

elements.label: Knotwingknot Nest
elements.description: There is a dark Wood that presses against the windows of the sleeping mind. There is a nest in the branches woven of black silk and white hair. Zulfiya has prepared a feast to take me there tonight, and inked something on the skin of my back, which she claims is a map I must not see.

elements.label: Palazzo Dario
elements.description: Two hundred years ago, an immortal named Hokobald worked alchemy here. In another hundred years, it may slide into the canal. It's wreathed in mist and prowled by gloomy dead, but Orsolina believes its vault has never been breached.

elements.label: Yeshiva Tigris
elements.description: For fifty years this secret yeshiva has taught the Four Traditions of the Bei Ilai: the imprisonment of spirits, the expulsion of monsters, the conclusion of tenacious curses and the sealing of troublesome portals. We'll have to find it to breach it; the rabbis and students will give us difficulty; and the Undergoer itself may need to be subdued.

elements.label: Skyrius T
elements.description: The authorities maintain a clandestine department dedicated to teratogenic phenomena. Once we've found its location, we'll have to breach its walls and weather the ghastly influences radiating from its heart.

elements.label: The Merry Feaster's Lair
elements.description: In the sewers below Aachen prowls one of the Lionsmith's less dignified works. We'll have to locate a hidden entrance and survive the sewers' atmosphere before we face the Feaster itself.

elements.label: Chateau Tarascon
elements.description: The family of the Duc de Tarascon has long been rumoured to breed monsters. They've employed French and German deserters to guard their mist-shrouded chateau.

elements.label: Duende Midnight
elements.description: High in the Alpujarras, there is an enclave of those who dance for the Thunderskin. They dislike being spied upon, and unless I prevent it, they will enact their dislike on the painter Mireya. I'll have to fight their sendings off and stay awake until dawn.

elements.label: Corpshaus Mamurra München
elements.description: A charming brick house with crow-stepped gables and a pair of venerable pines at the front door. In the attic, the Mamurren perform their rites of pain and courage. This will hurt.

elements.label: Church of St Marzanna the White
elements.description: On a hill above the city where the wind blows keen and fierce, a decaying wooden church stands in a bleak grove of leafless oak trees. Yitzchok tells me there's something in there I'll find useful, but he warns me: 'I looked in all my books for this St Marzanna. Where did I find her? Nowhere.'

elements.label: Fluttering Goo
elements.description: When I woke from the Wood, this is what I found in the sealed bottle beside my bed.

elements.label: Hokobald's Alchemical Substance
elements.description: Red as a forgotten sun.

elements.label: A Snoozing Undergoer
elements.description: When active, an undergoer is a flexile, half-formed, horribly alluring thing, eager to consume or be impregnated by mortals. But in its dormant state, it's a friendly knot of tentacled flesh, cawing, dribbling and snoring by turns.

elements.label: Maggot-Spice?
elements.description: The 'seasoning' Dominykas wanted: a pot of nasty-looking larval remnants. The pot is icy cold to the touch.

elements.label: The Merry Feaster's Carcass
elements.description: It's dissolving quickly as its internal structures corrode.

elements.label: Tarrasquine Relic
elements.description: I have what I need.

elements.label: Percussigant Pelt!
elements.description: E pur si muove! [Note: if you present this to Mireya as proof of your success, you'll still be able to keep it afterwards.]

elements.label: Percussigant Pelt!
elements.description: E pur si muove!

elements.label: Mamurren Scar
elements.description: Jannings says that some lessons can only be written on skin. That might be so, but it might be that Jannings just enjoys his work a little too much.
elements.comments: We switch it to a slightly different element so it doesn't get consumed by the ally recruitment recipe.

elements.label: Serapeum Peristasis
elements.description: I've entered one of the outer elements of the Invisible Serapeum - a sunny pillared porch of paradoxical size, where a certain Dr Blackwood will offer me a seat and a glass of iced hibiscus tea.

elements.label: Mamurren Scar
elements.description: Jannings says that some lessons can only be written on skin. That might be so, but it might be that Jannings just enjoys his work a little too much.

elements.label: Flowermaker-Touched
elements.description: One of my congregation knows things when they touch the skin of strangers, as long as their fingers are a little damp. They seem to enjoy it. [A Flowermaker Cult generates a cultist if you achieve at least one Effectiveness.]

elements.label: Flowermaker-Touched, Recovering
elements.description: 'I can't stop thinking about them. I should sleep.'

elements.label: Divided Soul
elements.description: One of my congregation has achieved a preternatural understanding of where entities begin, and where they end.[A Horned-Axe Cult generates a cultist if you achieve at least one Effectiveness.]

elements.label: Divided Soul, Recovering
elements.description: 'That was the day. Now this is the night.'

elements.label: Damned
elements.description: One of my congregation is eager to embrace their end. [A Wolf Divided Cult generates a cultist if you achieve at least one Effectiveness.]

elements.label: Fallen Labhite
elements.description: Labhites maintain their power and their position as long as they consume only those things that are found in the sky. This one's apparently been seduced by Echidna's notorious milks... which raises a number of questions, but the most urgent question is, what are we to do with him now?

elements.label: Zulfiya, the Barber
elements.description: Zulfiya never goes anywhere without her scissors.

elements.label: Orsolina, the Delver
elements.description: A muscular woman with a steady gaze. Her diet has changed since her days in the Lionsmith's service, but she still retains some of her old strength.

elements.label: Vasil, the Fivegoer
elements.description: A smoothly handsome man whose unhuman ancestry is not apparent, unless you know to look for his abnormally flexible fingers, or wonder why his nose tends to run.

elements.label: Dominykas, the Baker
elements.description: Dominykas has a ready smile and an unfortunate habit of picking his teeth.

elements.label: Lalla Chaima, the Huntress
elements.description: A lithe, hard-faced Berber woman in the grey-brown striped jellaba of a French-Moroccan auxiliary.

elements.label: Giorgiou, the Smuggler
elements.description: A melancholy and philosophical smuggler of rare cigarettes, rare poisons and rarer weapons.

elements.label: Mireya, the Visionary
elements.description: A plump, dreamy, hesitant woman with very bright eyes.

elements.label: Jannings, the Vivisectionist
elements.description: A specialist in disassembly and also in assembly.

elements.label: Zulfiya, Dreaming
elements.description: Zulfiya has left a scrawled note indicating that she will be 'walking the Wood' for some time yet.

elements.label: Orsolina, Dormant
elements.description: To recover her strength, Orsolina needs time alone and close to the earth.

elements.label: Vasil, Depleted
elements.description: Vasil's exertions have softened his shape. For now he has retreated, dripping and cawing, to somewhere warmer.

elements.label: Dominykas, Famished
elements.description: Dominykas has left to replenish himself, at the hearth and with the shovel.

elements.label: Lalla Chaima, Unseen
elements.description: Chaima has gone wherever she goes to lick her wounds in darkness.

elements.label: Giorgiou, Unavailable
elements.description: Giorgiou is in hiding until (he says) his nerves have recovered.

elements.label: Mireya, Indisposed
elements.description: Mireya is hiding, shivering, beneath her coverlet.

elements.label: Jannings, Reprovisioning
elements.description: Jannings has retired from the field until his new supplies arrive.

elements.label: Zulfiya, the Barber
elements.description: Zulfiya never goes anywhere without her scissors.

elements.label: Orsolina, the Delver
elements.description: A muscular woman with a steady gaze. Her diet has changed since her days in the Lionsmith's service, but she still retains some of her old strength.

elements.label: Vasil, the Fivegoer
elements.description: A smoothly handsome man whose unhuman ancestry is not apparent, unless you know to look for his abnormally flexible fingers, or wonder why his nose tends to run.

elements.label: Dominykas, the Baker
elements.description: Dominykas has a ready smile and an unfortunate habit of picking his teeth.

elements.label: Lalla Chaima, the Huntress
elements.description: A lithe, hard-faced Berber woman in the grey-brown striped jellaba of a French-Moroccan auxiliary.

elements.label: Giorgiou, the Smuggler
elements.description: A melancholy and philosophical smuggler of rare cigarettes, rare poisons and rarer weapons.

elements.label: Mireya, the Visionary
elements.description: A plump, dreamy, hesitant woman with very bright eyes.

elements.label: Jannings, the Vivisectionist
elements.description: A specialist in disassembly and also in assembly.

elements.label: Zulfiya, Dreaming
elements.description: Zulfiya has left a scrawled note indicating that she will be 'walking the Wood' for some time yet.

elements.label: Orsolina, Dormant
elements.description: To recover her strength, Orsolina needs time alone and close to the earth.

elements.label: Vasil, Depleted
elements.description: Vasil's exertions have softened his shape. For now he has retreated, dripping and cawing, to somewhere warmer.

elements.label: Dominykas, Famished
elements.description: Dominykas has left to replenish himself, at the hearth and with the shovel.

elements.label: Lalla Chaima, Unseen
elements.description: Chaima has gone wherever she goes to lick her wounds in darkness.

elements.label: Giorgiou, Unavailable
elements.description: Giorgiou is in hiding until (he says) his nerves have recovered.

elements.label: Mireya, Indisposed
elements.description: Mireya is hiding, shivering, beneath her coverlet.

elements.label: Jannings, Reprovisioning
elements.description: Jannings has retired from the field until his new supplies arrive.

elements.label: Opportunity: Purchase a Profane Weapon?
elements.description: It's much easier to find firearms now, since the War. [If you have a Profane Weapon already, this will replace it - which may be useful if it's Exhausted.]

elements.label: Opportunity: Purchase an Unusual Weapon?
elements.description: A battered-looking rifle sits prosaically on a counter in an antique shop.

elements.label: Opportunity: Purchase the 'Drinker's Knife'?
elements.description: An unexpected find in a gloomy pawn-shop.

elements.label: Opportunity: Purchase a Dangerous Substance?
elements.description: This would be illegal, if enough people knew it existed. [A Forge curio.]
elements.comments: not unique: can be purchased multiple times

elements.label: Opportunity: Purchase Red Temptation?
elements.description: Something viscous and sweet.[A Grail curio.]
elements.comments: not unique: can be purchased multiple times

elements.label: Opportunity: Purchase a Crudely Carved Image?
elements.description: 'Authentic,' I'm assured, 'just like the real thing.' [A Heart curio.]

elements.label: Opportunity: Purchase a Menacing Icon?
elements.description: This kind of thing is one reason I don't go to church. [A Knock curio.]

elements.label: Opportunity: Purchase a Mutilated Manuscript?
elements.description: A fistful of badly mistreated pages.[A Lantern curio.]

elements.label: Opportunity: Purchase a Mutilated Manuscript?
elements.description: A fistful of badly mistreated pages.[A Lantern curio.]

elements.label: Opportunity: Purchase a Mutilated Manuscript?
elements.description: A fistful of badly mistreated pages.[A Lantern curio.]

elements.label: Opportunity: Purchase an Unsettling Doll?
elements.description: 'It'll be back,' the seller informs me, gloomily. 'Do what you can with it in the meantime.' [A Moth curio.]

elements.label: Opportunity: Purchase an Odd Little Bone?
elements.description: They found it in a furnace, I'm told. [A Forge rarity.]

elements.label: Opportunity: Purchase an Antique Guitar?
elements.description: A certain musician has fallen on hard times. It will break her heart to part with this treasure, but a woman must eat. [A Heart rarity.]

elements.label: Opportunity: Purchase an Atlas of the Unsuspected
elements.description: There's always a way. [A Knock rarity.]

elements.label: Opportunity: Purchase Art about Yearning?
elements.description: A window on to what wasn't. [A Moth rarity.]

elements.label: Opportunity: Purchase Art about Finality?
elements.description: I'm told the artist died the night before he completed it. [A Winter rarity.]

elements.label: Opportunity: Purchase a Case of Extraordinary Wine?
elements.description: 'God made only water, but man made wine' - Victor Hugo. [A Grail rarity.]

elements.label: Opportunity: Discreet Office?
elements.description: I can lease a quiet place to work. [An Office provides a little Space, and, as a place of shelter, a little Heart.]

elements.label: Opportunity: Quiet Warehouse?
elements.description: I can lease space somewhere out of the way. [A Warehouse provides significant Space. As a good place to rest up or work on noisy projects, it also provides both Heart and Forge.]

elements.label: Opportunity: Grand Townhouse?
elements.description: I can acquire property. [A Townhouse provides significant Space. As a good place to take refuge or entertain guests, it provides both Heart and Grail. If you plan to retire here, it will also provide considerable Comfort.]

elements.label: Opportunity: Secluded Villa?
elements.description: I can acquire property. [A Villa provides significant Space, Forge, Heart, and Grail. If you plan to retire here, it will also provide tremendous Comfort.]

elements.label: Opportunity: Medical Credentials?
elements.description: I could take this opportunity to qualify, extremely rapidly, as a doctor.

elements.label: Opportunity: Import Licence?
elements.description: Certain goods are normally restricted; but I have friends now. [Import licences are only valid in the city where you acquire them.]

elements.label: Opportunity: An Official Connection?
elements.description: I could always use more friends.

elements.label: Opportunity: a Connection with a Ruler?
elements.description: A chance to get acquainted with someone of real importance.

elements.label: Opportunity: a Connection with a Holy Man?
elements.description: Charity brings clarity.

elements.label: Opportunity: a Connection with Radicals?
elements.description: This might have consequences. But I'm probably not planning to stick around.

elements.label: Opportunity: an Underworld Connection?
elements.description: I've been around, and when you get around, you get to know a certain kind of professional. That's just how it is.

elements.label: Beguiling Curio
elements.description: This will sit handsomely on a shelf, if I ever have shelves again.

elements.label: Curio: Adept's Powder
elements.description: A pinch of this goes up like lightning-struck thermite.

elements.label: Curio: Crème de Carmine
elements.description: I'd say it tasted like blood, if it didn't taste so good.

elements.label: Curio: Venetian Mommet
elements.description: Ugly little thing, but there's a cheering warmth to it.

elements.label: Curio: Bohemian Saint
elements.description: A nasty little illustration of what the pagans used to get up to. Or the Church. I don't know the history. I do know this icon has some kind of power over locks.

elements.label: Curio: Pages from the Book of Suns

slots.label: Cost
slots.description: I'll need to pay a specialist to restore and rebind the Book of Suns.

elements.description: Gorgeously illustrated manuscript pages, ripped from the original binding to be sold separately. I don't know the language - Persian? Arabic? but somehow I can read the words in sufficiently bright light. A dispute between Hours, a lineage concealed, a secret which shattered loyalties... not much practical information, but there's something about the sounds that sharpens the soul.

elements.label: Curio: Flûte Matutine
elements.description: 'No-one had any use for it, not any more, so I have made from it something both practical and charming, no?' [This can only be used when you have access to a Sea Port card.]

elements.label: Labhitic Memento
elements.description: The remains of someone who was not what their maker intended.

elements.label: Stained Gloves
elements.description: At first I think they're still warm. After a little while, I realise they'll always be warm.

elements.label: Khirqa-Caul
elements.description: This was my first garment in the world of air.

elements.label: Half-Smoked Cigarette
elements.description: Once, at a place and time of power and division, this knew the hands and mouth of a renegade Knock-Long. In at least one History, he finished smoking it.

elements.label: Sun-Kissed Stone
elements.description: A gift from someone who is not as he was.

elements.label: Curio: Threadbare Angel
elements.description: It smells like unopened rooms. Somehow I keep thinking it's changing its shape when I don't look at it, but I never catch it in the act. [No-one will buy this.]

elements.label: Rarity: Odd Little Bone
elements.description: Tiny, fragile-looking, but it packs a hell of a wallop.

elements.label: Rarity: Grese Guitar
elements.description: A guitar purchased long ago from the House of Stradivari, shaped from softly glowing Illyrian maple and inlaid with a design of almond leaves and pomegranates. I'd heard one had been stolen from the Gräfin von Grese's collection last year. It might be the last of its kind in a playable condition.

elements.label: Rarity: The Book of Suns, Reassembled
elements.description: There's a forgotten and golden truth in these images - a truth from the times before the Sun was divided. I don't understand it. It's not meant for me. But even the reflected light of that truth is an illumination.

elements.label: Rarity: Atlas of the Unsuspected
elements.description: This began life as an atlas of the cities of Europe. Over decades it's been extended and annotated by a dozen hands - adepts, burglars, soldiers, spies - to show secret routes and hiding-nooks.

elements.label: Stranger's Water
elements.description: A little jar of aggressively invasive saliva, like a viscid skeleton key.

elements.label: Rarity: 'Green as Remembered Rain'
elements.description: An oil painting of a final horizon, in green-and-gold and glory.

elements.label: 'Abydos Unveiled'
elements.description: An oil painting of a city foundered in snow. Behind its bleakest tower, a sickle moon rises.

elements.label: Rarity: Case of 1865 Domaine Raveline
elements.description: A great vintage wrung from a terroir ripe with secrets in the times before the Grand Blight. With discipline, patience, and resolution, it is possible to taste a glass of this wine and not to finish the bottle.

elements.label: Discreet Office
elements.description: Not too obvious, and not too far out of the way.

elements.label: Quiet Warehouse
elements.description: There's plenty of space here, although not much else to recommend it.

elements.label: Grand Townhouse
elements.description: The envy of every passerby. Let's close the curtains tightly.

elements.label: Jannings' Townhouse
elements.description: The envy of every passerby. Let's close the curtains tightly.

elements.label: Secluded Villa
elements.description: I could live out my days here very happily, if it weren't for certain immediate practical difficulties...

elements.label: Medical Credentials
elements.description: The name on the licence isn't exactly mine, but it's close enough.

elements.label: Import Licence
elements.description: The name on the licence isn't exactly mine, but it's close enough. [Import licences are only valid in the city where you acquire them.]

elements.label: Official Connection
elements.description: A mutually beneficial arrangement with someone in authority.

elements.label: Connection: Ruler
elements.description: A mutually beneficial arrangement with someone of real power.

elements.label: Connection: Holy Man
elements.description: A mutually beneficial arrangement with a learned holy man.

elements.label: Connection: Radicals
elements.description: A mutually beneficial arrangement with revolutionaries or other enthusiasts.

elements.label: Connection: Underworld
elements.description: A mutually beneficial arrangement with relevant professionals.

elements.label: An Escape Plan
elements.description: I need to get somewhere I'll be safe - at least for a little while.

elements.label: Profane Weapon
elements.description: A prosaic weight.

elements.label: Lionhunter's Rifle
elements.description: An antique rifle incised with the five-fold mark of the Many-Winged Ones. Three taenite-iron balls - monster-killers - remain. [The Lionhunter's Rifle refreshes quickly, but it can only be used three times.]

elements.label: Lionhunter's Rifle
elements.description: An antique rifle incised with the five-fold mark of the Many-Winged Ones. Two taenite-iron balls - monster-killers - remain. [The Lionhunter's Rifle is a sacred weapon, but it can only be used twice more.]

elements.label: Lionhunter's Rifle
elements.description: An antique rifle incised with the five-fold mark of the Many-Winged Ones. Only one taenite-iron ball remains. [The Lionhunter's Rifle is a sacred weapon, but it can only be used once more.]

elements.label: Ebrehel, the Ragged Sword
elements.description: In its long career (Yitzchok tells me), this weapon has also been called Gatemaker, Scarsword, and the Orphan. It was, apparently, commissioned to be borne by a king against an unbuilt city in an unknown season. It was turned to other purposes, however, and it will cut bits off mortals and immortals just fine. [The Foe cannot break Ebrehel.]

elements.label: Biedde's Blade
elements.description: One account has it that Biedde is a bastardised Arabic word for 'mosquito'. But my Foe used to number Biedde among the Colonel's Names. [Wounds from the Blade take much longer to heal.]

elements.label: Imhullune Tectrix
elements.description: It doesn't look like much, but at its touch, flesh perishes. Perhaps it really is a last fragment of the weapon that slew the Seven-Coiled from within.

elements.label: Histid's Dart
elements.description: The Tragulari, who are employed to hunt immortals, learnt their techniques from the Colonel's Histids. This dart is tipped with a skaptodon's tooth. [This is a sacred weapon that can only be used once.]

elements.label: Skaptodon's Sacrifice
elements.description: When a skaptodon falls in battle, the Lionsmith's servants often honour their sacrifice by shaping their teeth and claws into weapons. [This is a sacred weapon that can only be used once.]

elements.label: Profane Weapon (Readying)
elements.description: A prosaic weight.

elements.label: Lionhunter's Rifle (Readying)
elements.description: An antique rifle incised with the five-fold mark of the Many-Winged Ones. [The Lionhunter's Rifle is a sacred weapon, but it can only be fired twice more.]

elements.label: Lionhunter's Rifle (Readying)
elements.description: An antique rifle incised with the five-fold mark of the Many-Winged Ones. [The Lionhunter's Rifle is a sacred weapon, but it can only be fired once more.]

elements.label: Ebrehel, the Ragged Sword (Readying)
elements.description: In its long career, this weapon has also been called Gatemaker, Scarsword, and the Orphan. It was commissioned to be borne by kings against sieged cities, but it will cut bits off mortals and immortals just fine.

elements.label: Biedde's Blade (Readying)
elements.description: A cut from this blade will not cease bleeding until the wound is healed. One account has it that Biedde was a knife-collecting surgeon-highwayman in eighteenth-century Toulouse. Another claims Biedde is only the bastardisation of an Arabic word for 'mosquito'. But my Foe used to number Biedde among the Colonel's Names.

elements.label: Imhullune Tectrix (Readying)
elements.description: It doesn't look like much, but at its touch, flesh perishes. Perhaps it really is a last fragment of the weapon that slew the Seven-Coiled from within.

elements.label: Obscurity
elements.description: This might be the only defence against a reckoner lord. It might be no defence at all.

elements.label: Temptation: Escape
elements.description: I've stolen a fortune in years from a reckoner lord who trusted me. He'll pursue me across continents, but even his reach has limits. [Achieve seven Obscurity to send a taunting message to your reckoner Foe, disappear forever, and win the game.]

elements.label: Stolen Decade
elements.description: Ten years of generously donated life, as entered in the Cindered Tally.

elements.label: Stolen Year
elements.description: A year of generously donated life, as entered in the Cindered Tally.

elements.label: Trace
elements.description: A betraying clue that my pursuers might recognise. [Reckoners appear more quickly and are more powerful when there are more Traces on the board. The Foe himself can appear once there are at least five.]

elements.label: Diversion Effect for False Trails
elements.description: DO NOT TRANSLATE

elements.label: False Trail
elements.description: False but persuasive evidence that I'm somewhere I'm not. [While this is present on the board, reckoners won't arrive in your current city. But if they're already present, it won't help.]

elements.label: False Report
elements.description: My pursuer's reported that I've left the city. I'll have a brief period of grace before any more searchers arrive. [While this is present on the board, reckoners won't arrive in your current city. But if they're already present, it won't help.]

elements.label: A Nameless Blessing
elements.description: For a while yet, I'll walk in mist. [While this is present on the board, reckoners won't arrive in your current city. But if they're already present, it won't help.]

elements.label: Sunshine Island
elements.description: The light is famously good - enough so that a small colony of artists toils here - but it's still an optimistic name for a storm-beaten tumble of Baltic granite.

elements.label: Wounded Moon Lake
elements.description: Deep in the taiga forests of Siberia, a hunting lodge decays gracefully into an ice-blue lake - a lake, it's said, that a falling moon-fragment scarred from the forest.

elements.label: The Pentapolis
elements.description: On a high far limestone plateau in the greatest of deserts, the Mozabites built five citadel villages to be a refuge for their people. Now, one is a refuge for me.

elements.label: Hermitage of the Scythe
elements.description: Across the deadly sands, an oasis where peculiarly healthy villagers thrive. In the hills above, a sunny, rocky cell of three windows.

elements.label: Priory of Captains
elements.description: In the little sea called Morbihan, the gate to the western ocean, there's an isle famed for its sailors. On its westmost tip lies a quiet priory. The monks enjoy their privacy, but they've been known to offer sanctuary.

elements.label: The Tiger's Nest
elements.description: High in the abode of eternal snows, a monastery of the Diamond Vehicle clings improbably to a cliff face like flowers on lichen.

elements.label: Fogfire Point
elements.description: On an icy promontory in northernmost Norway, a lonely lighthouse stands proudly with its back to the ocean.

elements.label: Sunshine Island
elements.description: The light is famously good - enough so that a small colony of artists toils here - but it's still an optimistic name for a storm-beaten tumble of Baltic granite.

elements.label: Wounded Moon Lake
elements.description: Deep in the taiga forests of Siberia, a hunting lodge decays gracefully into an ice-blue lake - a lake, it's said, that a falling moon-fragment scarred from the forest.

elements.label: The Pentapolis
elements.description: On a high far limestone plateau in the greatest of deserts, the Mozabites built five citadel villages to be a refuge for their people. Now, one is a refuge for me.

elements.label: Hermitage of the Scythe
elements.description: Across the deadly sands, an oasis where peculiarly healthy villagers thrive. In the hills above, a sunny, rocky cell of three windows.

elements.label: Priory of Captains
elements.description: In the little sea called Morbihan, the gate to the western ocean, there's an isle famed for its sailors. On its westmost tip lies a quiet priory. The monks enjoy their privacy, but they've been known to offer sanctuary.

elements.label: The Tiger's Nest
elements.description: High in the abode of eternal snows, a monastery of the Diamond Vehicle clings improbably to a cliff face like flowers on lichen.

elements.label: Fogfire Point
elements.description: On an icy promontory in northernmost Norway, a lonely lighthouse stands proudly with its back to the ocean.

elements.label: Rhenish Aachen
elements.description: Republics come and republics go since the Great War. Just now, Aachen has its own republic under French patronage. I should be gone before it collapses.

elements.label: Alexandria
elements.description: Dignified men of business in tall red hats and immaculate white suits outside the Bourse; British soldiers bickering drunkenly by a melon-slice stall; theosophists playing backgammon in the Cafe Al Aktar. At the Rialto in Safiya Zaghloul, they're showing a German film about waxworks, but the power goes off and on and off again. Behind the curtain of night, the Invisible Serapeum waits.

elements.label: Algiers
elements.description: Pine scent and bougainvillea, white walls and ocean light, sirocco winds and the smoulder of revolution.

elements.label: Amsterdam
elements.description: The Golden Age is over, but glory lingers like fading music. Bicycles rattle across cobbles. A woman in white throws open the shutters of a high window. On misty evenings, the Nameless Name of the Velvet walks here.

elements.label: Avignon
elements.description: Sleepy Avignon, where the mistral blows.

elements.label: Baghdad
elements.description: Baking heat, dusty orange trees, tiled and genteel decay. The Ottomans did not favour Baghdad. Now the British have imported a Syrian puppet king, and alternate between building hospitals and bombing the locals into bloody compliance. The city is probably due another rebellion any day now.

elements.label: Budapest
elements.description: Winter in Budapest, and the Danube is dusted with snow. The Dual Monarchy has collapsed, but somehow this city is once again the capital of the Kingdom of Hungary. The King has twice tried to return, and twice been driven out. Politics.

elements.label: Candia-Heraklion
elements.description: A hard two decades. The Asia Minor Disaster; independence, and the Union with Greece; and then a monkey bit the King to death. But the Cretans and their island have endured four thousand years, and they endure still. The harbour is mountainous with fortifications, but Heraklion lies quiet in the afternoon sun.

elements.label: Cluj-Napoca
elements.description: Nestled in the mountains of sunset lies the city of the Archangel Michael. I remember it mostly as the place where I drank too much tsuica and got into a fight with bricklayers. We've all been young.

elements.label: Granada
elements.description: Cold clean air and hushed white streets and green-splashed patios and the mountains looking down. I might find something like respite.

elements.label: Istanbul
elements.description: Seven hills, three names, two continents and a hundred thousand cats. The bustle of the Grand Bazaar and the sudden silent dazzle of the Golden Horn.

elements.label: Kaunas (Little Paris)
elements.description: Half of Lithuania has fallen to Poland, and the peace is desperately fragile, but this is the capital now. They call it Little Paris, and the lamplight glows in the cafes and the dance halls. But there is a new president, and now the Association of the Iron Wolf begins to tighten its jaws.

elements.label: Kyiv
elements.description: The city of the black earth and the golden gate. For a little while it was free, but first the Marshal and then the Red Army put an end to that.

elements.label: Kraków
elements.description: The castle on the hill where the dragon died looks out across a city mellow with October sunlight. Just don't speak ill of the Marshal.

elements.label: Leningrad
elements.description: Lenin is dead, and the old capital now carries his name. It carries, too, the scars of the Revolution, of the Red Terror, and now of the September Deluge. The streets still stink of the Neva mud. In a dim curtained office high in the Tauride Palace, Zinoviev awaits Stalin's next move.

elements.label: London
elements.description: Mass strikes and martial law have paralysed the big smoke this month. Tanks rumble along Pall Mall. Agitators conspire in the city's lethal fogs. Perhaps the Nameless Name will shield me with her mists...

elements.label: Marrakech
elements.description: Five hundred miles away, the Republic of the Rif wages guerilla war against the French Protectorate. But here in Marrakech it's still mint tea and parasols.

elements.label: Meshad
elements.description: A mild and turquoise sunset in Meshad, and the lights along Khayam Boulevard flickering to life. Armoured cars growl past: the new Shah is wary. A thousand years ago, here between the mountains, Ferdowsi wrote: 'How shall a man escape from that which is written; How shall he flee from his destiny?' It's a good question, actually.

elements.label: Munich
elements.description: Munich is still a gracious city, and the chestnuts are very lovely in the spring. But hatreds old and new, and the privations of the Great War, make it a difficult place just now. More so since the beer-hall business last year with Ludendorff and that godawful little Austrian.

elements.label: Nizhny Novgorod
elements.description: For a hundred years, here where the Volga and the Oka meet, all the riches of old Russia and beyond have met at Nizhny Great Fair. Now the Red Army garrisons the echoing old spaces, but still the goods come. Copper, salt, grain, tea; wool, coal, nails, flesh.

elements.label: Paris
elements.description: This year in the City of Lights, the socialists battle the communists, the Métro grumbles, gaunt artists prowl bookshops on the Other Bank. Plus ça change.

elements.label: Prague
elements.description: The City of a Hundred Spires, flexing its republican muscles beneath the benign gaze of Masaryk and his Castlemen. Statues watch the bridges each night. This is Europe's heart, and for a while longer, it will beat with cheery vigour.

elements.label: Rostock
elements.description: Beyond the kerosene bustle of the great port, here by the dark sea where the amber comes to light, ancient clockwork drives the Warnemünde Lighthouse. Each night it winks at the horizon.

elements.label: Samarkand
elements.description: The metropolis of the conqueror Timur, the crossroads of the silk trade, the city of a hundred faiths. The Tsars and now the Bolsheviks have ruled here since the Manghit emirs were ousted.

elements.label: Stalingrad
elements.description: Midnight in Stalingrad. Everywhere, posters of the Georgian radiate avuncular menace across the moonlit streets.

elements.label: Strasbourg
elements.description: Here were sworn the great oaths that divided the empire of the great Charles between east and west. In consequence, the land has been contested for a thousand years; in consequence, the shadow of the Horned Axe lies long here. Also, there's a cheery little bistro where they serve that stew with juniper and white wine that I like.

elements.label: Sverdlovsk
elements.description: This was always the city of the jewel-merchants and the malachite miners. Now the Bolsheviks are remaking it as a crucible of heavy industry.

elements.label: Tiflis
elements.description: The falcon-king found the sulphur-springs, and built his city here. Now it's the capital of the Transcaucasian Socialist Federative Soviet Republic, and there are motor-cars, a telegraph office. Progress.

elements.label: Tirana
elements.description: Flower-thronged Tirana, where Zogist soldiers crowd the cafes with drunken laughter, where the Flowermaker hums his dreamy songs in the bee-droning shadows.

elements.label: Tripoli dell'ovest
elements.description: The Spanish took Tripoli from the Berbers, the Knights of St John took it from the Spanish, the Ottomans took it from the Knights, and now the Italians run the place. The Berbers called Tripoli 'the Bride of the Sea'. And, if I can believe my Foe, my mother called it 'home'.

elements.label: Valletta
elements.description: Sunny seat of the Crown Colony of Malta. British sailors saunter along the sloping streets. The battleship Royal Rose dominates the harbour like an iron cathedral.

elements.label: Venice
elements.description: Deep fog has made Venice a pale city more heard than seen: the plash of waves, the purr of vaporettos, the scent of seaweed and sewage. The sun is a blind eye. If ever the Nameless Name of the Velvet walks by day, she must walk here.

elements.label: Vienna
elements.description: One of those few cities which has the same name in every History... if you believe that sort of thing. For a very long time it was the first heart of the Dual Empire, and for the longest time the adepts have known it as the White City. But now it's Red Vienna under the First Republic, and the streets are bright with dawn.

elements.label: Aachen in Flames
elements.description: Rhenish separatists are fighting German loyalists in the streets. I should leave while I still can.

elements.label: Algiers in Flames
elements.description: Nationalists are fighting French troops in the streets. I should leave while I still can.

elements.label: Baghdad in Flames
elements.description: Hashemite forces are fighting nationalists in the streets. I should leave while I still can.

elements.label: Istanbul in Flames
elements.description: Revolutionaries and counter-revolutionaries are fighting street to street. I should leave while I still can.

elements.label: Kyiv in Flames
elements.description: Revolutionaries and counter-revolutionaries are fighting street to street. I should leave while I still can.

elements.label: Leningrad in Flames
elements.description: Revolutionaries and counter-revolutionaries are fighting street to street. I should leave while I still can.

elements.label: London in Flames
elements.description: Police are fighting pitched battles with workers in the streets. I should leave while I still can.

elements.label: Munich in Flames
elements.description: Communists and and nationalists are fighting street-to-street. I should leave while I still can.

elements.label: Nizhny Novgorod in Flames
elements.description: Revolutionaries and counter-revolutionaries are fighting street to street. I should leave while I still can.

elements.label: Samarkand in Flames
elements.description: Soviets and Jadidists are fighting street to street. I should leave while I still can.

elements.label: Stalingrad in Flames
elements.description: Revolutionaries and counter-revolutionaries are fighting street to street. I should leave while I still can.

elements.label: Sverdlovsk in Flames
elements.description: Revolutionaries and counter-revolutionaries are fighting street to street. I should leave while I still can.

elements.label: Tiflis in Flames
elements.description: Revolutionaries and counter-revolutionaries are fighting street to street. I should leave while I still can.

elements.label: Rhenish Aachen
elements.description: A message from Aachen has found me. An old acquaintance from Marrakech is hunting there. She'd like my help. [Once you leave the current city, this will never be available again.]

elements.label: Alexandria
elements.description: Back before the war, I was invited to the Invisible Serapeum in Alexandria. With luck, the invitation is still open. [Once you leave the current city, this will never be available again.]

elements.label: Algiers
elements.description: My smuggler contact, M. Giorgiou, has people in Algiers. They could get me in there quietly. [Once you leave the current city, this will never be available again.]

elements.label: Amsterdam
elements.description: Over the years I've found a dozen treasures for the Stegenga twins in Amsterdam. They may give me shelter. [Once you leave the current city, this will never be available again.]

elements.label: Avignon
elements.description: A smuggler contact in Avignon, M. Giorgiou, has a proposition for me. [Once you leave the current city, this will never be available again.]

elements.label: Baghdad
elements.description: Percy Styles is still in Baghdad, doing whatever it is he does for the British government in Mandatory Iraq. He'd probably still be glad to see me.  [Once you leave the current city, this will never be available again.]

elements.label: Budapest
elements.description: I hear my old friend Lili has moved her black market operations to Budapest. [Once you leave the current city, this will never be available again.]

elements.label: Candia-Heraklion
elements.description: It's a long time since I was in Crete, but I've been dreaming about it again, and about the scent of hawthorn... [Once you leave the current city, this will never be available again.]

elements.label: Cluj-Napoca
elements.description: My old friend Lili's operations in Cluj have suffered since Hungary gave the city up, but her name might still open doors. [Once you leave the current city, this will never be available again.]

elements.label: Granada
elements.description: I've had dealings with a gallery owner in Granada. Last year she invited me to stay with her. [Once you leave the current city, this will never be available again.]

elements.label: Istanbul
elements.description: My old comrade-in-arms Kara Kemal has connections with the Black Arm remnants in Istanbul. Perhaps his name will still open doors. [Once you leave the current city, this will never be available again.]

elements.label: Kaunas (Little Paris)
elements.description: Dominykas the Baker has done well for himself: high-level connections in the Iron Wolf in Kaunas. We never really got on, but he owes me, and I can't be fussy. [Once you leave the current city, this will never be available again.]

elements.label: Kyiv
elements.description: I've heard rumours the hungriest of the Ligeians is abroad in Kyiv. My pursuers will need to tread carefully there, but then, so will I. [Once you leave the current city, this will never be available again.]

elements.label: Kraków
elements.description: Yitzchok Ashlag in Krakow has relied on me for years for the rarer occult texts. He's a hospitable man. [Once you leave the current city, this will never be available again.]

elements.label: Leningrad
elements.description: The 'Athenians' who sell years in Russia are sworn enemies of the Reckoner mobs, but I've been known to get drunk with a certain Sushkin. Let's hope he remembers me. [Once you leave the current city, this will never be available again.]

elements.label: London
elements.description: Ottavio Berton in London has put out the word that he'd like my help. He's a scoundrel, but we go back a long way. [Once you leave the current city, this will never be available again.]

elements.label: Marrakech
elements.description: A marabout named Navil has somehow discovered I'm here. His message reads only 'COME TO MARRAKECH, FOR GLORY' [Once you leave the current city, this will never be available again.]

elements.label: Meshad
elements.description: A very old poet in Meshad has long been a favourite customer of mine. She'll certainly offer me hospitality. [Once you leave the current city, this will never be available again.]

elements.label: Munich
elements.description: I have a standing invitation from Count Gottlieb Jannings, of Munich, to attend a meeting of the duelling society he favours. [Once you leave the current city, this will never be available again.]

elements.label: Nizhny Novgorod
elements.description: Sushkin of the 'Athenians' has kept his import-export operation in Nizhny running, but it's difficult under the Soviets. His people there might be glad of my help. [Once you leave the current city, this will never be available again.]

elements.label: Paris
elements.description: Tante Adeline's moved on, but she still has people in Paris, and they'll give me shelter. [Once you leave the current city, this will never be available again.]

elements.label: Prague
elements.description: The old rogue in Prague who calls herself 'Tante Adeline' could use my help. [Once you leave the current city, this will never be available again.]

elements.label: Rostock
elements.description: My correspondent Count Jannings has a house in Rostock that I could use. [Once you leave the current city, this will never be available again.]

elements.label: Samarkand
elements.description: I used to supply proscribed materials to a Jadidist magus in Samarkand. Perhaps he remembers me. [Once you leave the current city, this will never be available again.]

elements.label: Stalingrad
elements.description: The criminal adepts called the Bird-Eaters have set their faces against the laws of both man and Mansus. I had heard that Zulfiya the Barber had joined them in Stalingrad. The Bird-Eaters are not good people. But I always liked Zulfiya. [Once you leave the current city, this will never be available again.]

elements.label: Strasbourg
elements.description: The Hügelkinder of the Vosges sometimes take human shape to walk the streets of Strasbourg. I've dealt with them before. They know as well as anyone how to be unobtrusive: perhaps they can help. [Once you leave the current city, this will never be available again.]

elements.label: Sverdlovsk
elements.description: Zulfiya the Barber used to buy life from me with jewels in the city of Sverdlovsk. She's turned strange and moved on to another city, but she introduced me to some of her contacts, back before the Civil War. [Once you leave the current city, this will never be available again.]

elements.label: Tiflis
elements.description: Vasil the Fivegoer took refuge from the reckoners in Tiflis long ago. He owes me, though he might not welcome my visit. [Once you leave the current city, this will never be available again.]

elements.label: Tirana
elements.description: Before all this went bad, I was negotiating a sale of life with one of President Zogu's people in Tirana. I still have her address. [Once you leave the current city, this will never be available again.]

elements.label: Tripoli dell'ovest
elements.description: I don't have any people in Tripoli. I don't remember it at all. But quite some time ago, in the days of the Ottomans, I was born here. [Once you leave the current city, this will never be available again.]

elements.label: Valletta
elements.description: My old comrade-in-arms Kara Kemal is in exile in Valletta. It's been a while, but I did save his life in the Great War... [Once you leave the current city, this will never be available again.]

elements.label: Venice
elements.description: I know a woman named Orsolina in Venice. She wasn't always a woman. But she's lived there a very long time. [Once you leave the current city, this will never be available again.]

elements.label: Vienna
elements.description: It was the White City once. Now they call it 'Red Vienna'. There's a Ligeian here, and the scars of the Worm Wars are still visible to those who know. But if I'm to die, I'd like to see the old place one more time. [Once you leave the current city, this will never be available again.]

elements.label: A Dash Cross-Country
elements.description: Out into the wilds. This should be my last resort. [Few opportunities of any use, and you can't survive out there for long.]

elements.label: Lonely Places Between
elements.description: There are always choices. I could die of thirst, or cold, or hunger. [Few opportunities of any use, and you'll have to take whatever road onwards presents itself.]

elements.label: Freezing Winds
elements.description: Frost walks here.

elements.label: Trembling Heat
elements.description: The air shimmers like a naked furnace. Serpents' weather.

elements.label: The Sea
elements.description: We're by the sea, here, and the sea bears gifts: peace, or death, or escape.

slots.label: More
slots.description: Something I can only use by the sea.

elements.label: Faith
elements.description: I've passed a place of worship.

elements.label: Cats
elements.description: I've found a place bristling with excitable cats.

elements.label: Heights
elements.description: A high place. Don't look down.

elements.label: The Horned Axe's Shadow
elements.description: The smell of hawthorn, and the colour of sunset bisected with shadow. The Horned Axe is strong here.

elements.label: The Wolf Divided's Shadow
elements.description: That scent which is neither tar nor blood nor ozone. The Wolf-Divided's rage boils beneath the air.

elements.label: The Wolf Divided's Attention
elements.description: An unclean flame smoulders beneath the world's skin. I've invoked the Wolf, and like it or not, I'm doing his work.

elements.label: The Flowermaker's Shadow
elements.description: Here are sweet airs, here are the beginnings of dreams... here our thoughts turn to the Hour called Flowermaker.

elements.label: Echidna
elements.description: Here at the desert's edge, Echidna doesn't always bother with human form. With luck, I'll never see what shape she prefers.

elements.label: Frau Schlüssel
elements.description: I know that Frau Schlüssel has lived here since long before the siege. If I don't call her attention, perhaps I'll be safe.

elements.label: Our Lady of Wires
elements.description: Whatever 'Our Lady of Wires' might be, it has chosen Kyiv for its feeding-grounds this year.

elements.label: What is Not Seen?
elements.description: In all of this city, there is not one statue whose eyes are open. Why is that?

elements.label: Mme Matutine
elements.description: Mme Matutine's yacht, the Sapphire, lies at anchor here. Mme Matutine has a lethal reputation.

elements.label: Sulochana
elements.description: Sulochana Amavasya lairs at the Ecdysis Club, but she's abroad in the city this week. I should avoid her.

elements.label: Dawn
elements.description: Sunrise, when the world is clean.

elements.label: Sunset
elements.description: Sunset, when the light is richer.

elements.label: Night
elements.description: The deep watches of the night, and again I can't sleep.

elements.label: Temptation: Defiance
elements.description: 'Caput gerat lupinum', they used to say of outlaws. 'This is the line of division.' Or something like that. Latin was never my strong point. I'm on the wrong side of that line of division now... but perhaps that's also an opportunity.

slots.label: Contents
slots.description: I could tell my Foe where I am. Or even send him a gift.

elements.label: Tranquillity
elements.description: Even in a life like mine, there are moments when it's possible to think: what may come, may come.

elements.label: Grief
elements.description: Everything ends.

elements.label: Rage
elements.description: 'Beware the fury of a patient man.' - Dryden, 'Absalom and Achitophel'

elements.label: My Wound
elements.description: Seven of these will end me.

slots.label: Repurposed Life
slots.description: This wound could cost me ten years - unless I replace those years.

elements.label: My Wound
elements.description: Seven of these will end me. [This Wound will take twice as long to heal.]

slots.label: Repurposed Life
slots.description: This wound could cost me ten years - unless I replace those years.

elements.label: My Unhealing Wound
elements.description: Six more wounds will end me. This wound will not heal without extraordinary measures.

slots.label: Repurposed Life
slots.description: This wound could cost me ten years - unless I replace those years.

elements.label: Foe's Wound
elements.description: Seven of these will end my enemy.

elements.label: Foe's Unstanchable Wound
elements.description: Seven wounds will end my enemy. [This Wound will take twice as long to heal.]

elements.label: Pursuer's Wound
elements.description: Two Wounds will kill most reckoners. Four will kill an Underboss.

elements.label: Pursuer's Unstanchable Wound
elements.description: Two Wounds will kill most reckoners. Four will kill an Underboss. [This Wound will take twice as long to heal.]

elements.label: Reckoner Informants
elements.description: The reckoner mob has turned its attention to this city. [Informants won't harm you directly, but they may be able to summon more dangerous enemies.]

elements.label: Reckoner Operative
elements.description: I recognised a face in the street. We worked together once. Was I spotted? [Reckoner Operatives will try to steal your Assets.]

elements.label: Reckoner Assassin
elements.description: Someone has been asking after me. I recognise the description of that someone, too well. [Assassins will try to murder you.]

elements.label: Reckoner Underboss
elements.description: A reckoner lieutenant, winnowed from the ranks by ferocity and guile, grown sleek on borrowed years. [Underbosses may steal assets, attack you directly, or summon the Foe.]

elements.label: My Foe
elements.description: Seasoned like oak and scarred like sea-cliffs. I have seen his strength, and I would be a fool not to fear it.

elements.label: A Trophy of my Foe
elements.description: How many times did this heart beat? How many of those beats were stolen from another? It is withering now.

elements.label: Weakness: Cold
elements.description: The rumours are true - snow makes my Foe slow and stupid. (Heat and the sea don't trouble him, though.)

elements.label: Weakness: Heat
elements.description: The rumours are true - when the weather is hot enough, my foe becomes slow and stupid. (Cold and the sea don't trouble him, though.)

elements.label: Weakness: the Sea
elements.description: All reckoners treat the sea with caution. But it's true what I've heard: my Foe fears its touch. (Heat and cold don't bother him, though.)

elements.label: Weakness: Faith
elements.description: A religious upbringing? A persistent superstition? My enemy is reluctant to desecrate holy places. (But he doesn't avoid cats, or heights.)

elements.label: Weakness: Cats
elements.description: My Foe fears cats! He's long been ready to murder anyone who even hinted as much. Now I know why. (But he doesn't avoid holy places, or heights.)

elements.label: Weakness: Heights
elements.description: High places dizzy and demoralise my Foe. (But he doesn't avoid cats, or holy places.)

elements.label: Weakness: Horned Axe's Disfavour
elements.description: The Horned Axe does not favour my Foe, and where its shadow falls, he hesitates. (But he doesn't have any especial fear of the other Hours.)

elements.label: Weakness: Wolf-Divided's Hatred
elements.description: If half the stories of this thing are true, it hates everything with near-equal incandescence. But in my Foe's case, the Wolf's rage burns a fraction hotter. (He doesn't have any especial fear of the other Hours.)

elements.label: Weakness: Flowermaker
elements.description: Something about the Flowermaker's influence confounds my Foe. I may never know exactly what. (But he doesn't have any especial fear of the other Hours.)

elements.label: An Unknown Weakness
elements.description: If I can uncover this weakness, it'll give me an advantage.

elements.label: An Unknown Weakness
elements.description: If I can uncover this weakness, it'll give me an advantage.

elements.label: An Unknown Weakness
elements.description: If I can uncover this weakness, it'll give me an advantage.

elements.label: An Unknown Weakness
elements.description: If I can uncover this weakness, it'll give me an advantage.

elements.label: An Unknown Weakness
elements.description: If I can uncover this weakness, it'll give me an advantage.

elements.label: An Unknown Weakness
elements.description: If I can uncover this weakness, it'll give me an advantage.

elements.label: An Unknown Weakness
elements.description: If I can uncover this weakness, it'll give me an advantage.

elements.label: An Unknown Weakness
elements.description: If I can uncover this weakness, it'll give me an advantage.

elements.label: An Unknown Weakness
elements.description: If I can uncover this weakness, it'll give me an advantage.

elements.label: Reckoners: Aggressive
elements.description: My pursuers are active tonight

elements.label: Reckoners: Passive
elements.description: My pursuers are hesitating
